rules: Rule1: If the Compliance Officer monitors compliance, then should the Platform comply with Data Privacy Law, the Platform operates legally.
Rule2: Either the Compliance Officer monitors compliance or the External Auditor audits the system.
Rule3: Provided that the External Auditor audits the system, then if the Platform complies with Data Privacy Law, the Platform operates legally.
Rule4: When the Platform violates regulation, the Platform receives a penalty.
Rule5: The Regulatory Body finds a violation if the Regulatory Body initiates investigation.
Rule6: Either the Regulatory Body initiates investigation or the Platform does not violate regulation.
Rule7: If the Regulatory Body suspends license, then either the Regulatory Body issues a fine or the Regulatory Body does not initiate investigation.
Rule8: The Platform appeals the decision only if the Regulatory Body suspends license.
Rule9: Provided that the Platform Legal Team files an appeal, then if the Platform does not operate legally, the Platform restores service.
Rule10: Either the Platform Legal Team files an appeal or the Platform Legal Team submits evidence.
Rule11: The Platform Legal Team submits evidence only if the Legal Counsel presents the case.
Rule12: The Legal Counsel gathers evidence provided that the Legal Counsel presents the case.
Rule13: If the Legal Counsel wins the appeal, then should the Platform not operate legally, the Platform restores service.
Rule14: The Legal Counsel wins the appeal if the Legal Counsel prepares documentation.
Rule15: The Legal Counsel prepares documentation when the Legal Counsel gathers evidence.
Rule16: Either the Platform terminates the Compliance Manager employee or the Regulatory Body does not initiate investigation.
Rule17: When the Platform restructures the Compliance Department team, the Platform hires the Security Firm consultant.
Rule18: Either the Regulatory Body extends the deadline or if the Platform terminates the Compliance Manager employee, then the Platform restructures the Compliance Department team.

Rule19: If the Government Agency submits a proposal, then provided that it is not the case that the Platform does not operate legally leading to the Platform receiving funding, the Platform does not pass audit.
Rule20: Either the Government Agency submits a proposal or the Regulatory Body reviews the proposal.
Rule21: The Platform does not violate regulation if the Platform demonstrates compliance.
Rule22: Either the Platform requests a hearing or the Platform demonstrates compliance.
Rule23: The Regulatory Body does not find a violation when the Regulatory Body issues a warning.
Rule24: Either the Regulatory Body renews the license or the Regulatory Body does not close the case.
Rule25: The Regulatory Body requests changes when the Regulatory Body reviews the proposal.
Rule26: Provided that the Regulatory Body requests changes, then if the Platform not operating legally does not lead to the Platform receiving funding, the Platform does not pass audit.
Rule27: The Platform operates legally if the Platform implements the Authentication Module feature.
Rule28: Either the Platform implements the Authentication Module feature or the Platform deploys the Security Patch update.
Rule29: If the QA Team tests the Authorization System component, then should the Platform deploy the Security Patch update, the Platform operates legally.
Rule30: The QA Team tests the Authorization System component if the QA Lead approves the Authorization System test.
Rule31: Should it not be the case that the Platform violating regulation leads to the Platform not receiving a penalty, then the Platform faces a lawsuit.
Rule32: If it is not true that the Regulatory Body initiating investigation results in the Regulatory Body issuing a warning, then the Regulatory Body closes the case.
Rule33: Provided that the Platform not operating legally does not lead to the Platform receiving funding, then the Platform passes audit.
Rule34: The Platform accepts penalty if the Platform does not appeal the decision.
Rule35: The Platform violates regulation if the Platform does not operate legally.
Rule36: The Platform does not receive funding if the Platform does not operate legally.
Rule37: The Platform does not restore service when the Platform does not operate legally.
facts: Fact1: The Platform complies with Data Privacy Law.
Fact2: The QA Lead approves the Authorization System test.
Fact3: The Regulatory Body does not issue a fine.
Fact4: The Platform does not accept penalty.
Fact5: The Platform does not hire the Security Firm consultant.
Fact6: The Regulatory Body does not extend the deadline.
Fact7: The Platform does not request a hearing.
Fact8: The Regulatory Body does not renew the license.
Fact9: The Platform does not face a lawsuit.
